intro: Cracca calcarata var. cinerea, commonly known as the pale cracca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, grayish-blue foliage. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow to orange in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
